name: Literacy Reflection
desc: Focuses on reflective literacy teaching: problematizing, processes of understanding students' thinking about reading and writing.

name: Assessment and Accountability
desc: Provides students with the opportunity to review, renew, and expand their understanding of assessment and program evaluation procedures, as well as the role of accountability in educational settings.

name: Reinventing Teaching
desc: Admission to the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Addresses contexts of teaching, teaching in the world, and teaching students in schools. This course is designed for experienced educators to reinvent teachers and teaching.""

name: Teacher Researcher I
desc: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers program required. Explores the meanings of research and the potential roles of teachers in conducting research. Teachers formulate possible individual or small group research projects that they can carry out during the year.

name: Teacher Researcher II
desc: Teachers will plan and conduct advanced inquiry/research projects informed by their knowledge of teacher-research and their experience as teacher-researchers garnered through their successful completion of EDMX 708.

name: Teacher Leadership for a Democratic Society
desc: Focuses on the nature of change and teachers' roles as leaders within a changing environment. Several themes are addressed: shaping school cultures, schools as communities, schools as sites for reform, and politics and schools.

name: Assessment and Differentiation
desc: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate assessment.

name: Assessment and Differentiation
desc: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate instruction. Using a case-based approach, teachers examine the areas of human development, special education and inclusion, cultural diversity, linguistic diversity, cognitive styles, and multiple intelligences as frames through which to consider creative environments to promote students' classroom success.

name: Content-Area Reading and Writing
desc: Focuses on current theory, research, and issues in the teaching and use of reading and writing in the content areas. This is an introductory course.

name: Advanced Reflective Literacy Teaching
desc: Teachers will learn how to problematize assessment of students' thinking about reading and writing in this practicum course.

name: Number Systems and Operations: K-5 Mathematical Tasks
desc: Course has major restrictions. Analysis and construction of effective mathematical tasks in teaching number systems and operations at the K-5 level; attention is also given to the expansion of content knowledge.

name: Data Analysis and Measurement: K-5 Classroom Interactions
desc: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on statistical literacy of elementary teachers and the teaching of data analysis and measurement to K-5 students; attention is also given to learning methods that facilitate appropriate classroom interactions.

name: Rational Numbers and Operations: K-5 Learning Trajectories
desc: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on rational number concepts through learning trajectories at the K-5 level. Attention also given to problem solving and content knowledge.

name: Revisiting Real Numbers Concepts
desc: Uses a problem-based format and group work to explore the mathematics of the real numbers with an emphasis on rational numbers.

name: Algebraic Reasoning: K-5 Discourse and Questioning
desc: Course has major restrictions. Focus on the early algebra concepts of functional thinking and generalized arithmetic in relationship to pedagogical practices centered on questioning in the mathematics classroom.

name: Topics in Mathematics Education: Geometry
desc: Provides students with a mathematical foundation and cognitive support for elementary and middle school geometry. Specific goals address structure of elementary and middle school geometry.

name: Geometry and Spatial Visualization: K-5 Assessment
desc: Course has major restrictions. Geometric concept development along with formative and summative assessment strategies of students' geometric thinking. Attention also is given to geometric content knowledge and diagnosis of student errors.

name: Writing in the 21st Century
desc: Focuses on the writing process and the theoretical foundations necessary to become practitioners who can develop and implement effective writing instruction using 21st-century skills.

name: Explorations in Literacy
desc: Explores what it means to be a reader and writer, the nature of development of literacy.

name: Spanish for Educators
desc: This graduate-level course is an introductory immersion-style Spanish course for anyone involved in education. Learners will acquire novice-level proficiency in Spanish and an awareness of Hispanic culture.

name: Revisiting Literacy
desc: Explores literacy topics as capstone course for master's or licensure program in literacy.

name: Math and Content Area Methods: Special Education, General Curriculum
desc: Students will learn characteristics of students with mild to moderate learning disabilities in math, social studies, and science. They will also learn assessment techniques and instructional methods to address these specific characteristics.

name: Mathematical Modeling: K-5 Leadership
desc: Restricted to majors. Generating mathematical representations and making explicit connections between concepts. Pedagogy designed to equip elementary teachers to become mathematics teacher-leaders in school settings. Focuses on topics integrated within mathematical strands.

name: Social Studies Pedagogy A
desc: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.

name: Social Studies Pedagogy B
desc: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.

name: Contemporary Research for Social Studies Teaching
desc: Focuses on current research topics and methodologies in the field of social studies education and examines their implications on the field.

name: Integrated Learning
desc: Builds on earlier coursework and will include teachers from each of the two concentrations in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers. It focuses on exploring what is meant by integrated curriculum and understanding the process of developmental research as it relates to the design and use of curricula.

name: Social Studies/Humanities
desc: Aims to develop social studies teachers' understanding of social science and humanities through an interdisciplinary inquiry process.

name: Advanced Emergent and Early Literacy
desc: Advanced course on emergent and early literacy, focusing on the research and theory in the development of reading and writing processes from birth through first grade, emphasizing the cognitive and socio-cultural perspectives.

name: Diversity Global Education
desc: Provides a linked perspective on international studies and multicultural education. Students explore issues relevant to these two topics as they relate to teaching and learning in social studies.

name: Families and Teams in Early Childhood Intervention: Interdisciplinary Perspectives
desc: Open to graduate students only. Explores issues and models of family-professional and interprofessional relationships in early childhood settings. Collaborative communication and problem-solving strategies are emphasized in the context of diversity.

name: Early Childhood Assessment Strategies
desc: Open to graduate students only. Provides an overview and application of strategies for developmental screenings, normative evaluations, curriculum, and play-based assessments for young children ages birth through five.

name: Preschool/Kindergarten Curriculum and Learning Environments
desc: Open to graduate students only. Focuses on individually, developmentally, and culturally appropriate learning environment and curriculum strategies for young children with and without disabilities ages three to five.

name: Infant/Toddler Curriculum and Learning Environment
desc: Focuses on infant/toddler development and mental health strategies for facilitating development in the home and in child care.

name: Professional Development and Leadership in Early Childhood Intervention
desc: Focuses on leadership skills in mentoring, supervision, staff development, resource gathering, and applied research related to early childhood settings.

name: Seminar in Science Education
desc: Teaches students curriculum and instruction strategies in science education. The focus of the course is on teaching and assessing science for conceptual understanding.

name: Perspectives on Science Education: Physical Science
desc: Examines physical science domains in depth. Students reflect on their own understandings of science phenomena and research their students' understandings.

name: Perspectives on Science Education: Life Science
desc: Studies the history of science education, curriculum design, and national reform ideas as well as projects and programs currently used in United States classrooms.

name: Perspectives of Science Education: Earth, Space, and Environmental Science
desc: Explores current reforms in science education through an examination of critical topics in earth-space science.

name: Big Ideas in Science Education
desc: Through investigations, research, and guest speakers, this course engages students in discussions about teaching science in conjunction with issues of technology and society.

name: Behavioral Support Techniques
desc: Emphasizes effective behavior management and applied behavior analysis techniques for intervening in the environments of exceptional children to increase learning.

name: Designing Problem Tasks for Mathematics
desc: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities.

name: Problem-Based Learning in Mathematics
desc: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities: tasks, problems, and materials with which students and teachers engage.

name: Developing Mathematical Knowledge
desc: Designed to help teachers think through the major mathematical ideas of the curriculum and to examine how students develop these ideas.

name: Culturally Responsive Teaching
desc: This course initiates thoughtful discussion of race and culture in our schools by exploring history, identity, and issues in academic achievement.
